61931-08.CEOBiography: Mr. W. Barry McCarthy serves as President, Chief Executive Officer & Director at Peloton. He is a seasoned executive who served as CFO of Spotify from 2015 to January 2020, and CFO of Netflix from 1999 to 2010. Prior to Netflix, he held various leadership positions in management consulting, investment banking, and media and entertainment. He has served on the boards of directors of Spotify and Instacart since January 2020 and January 2021, respectively. In addition, he has served as a member of the boards of Chegg, Eventbrite, MSD Acquisition, Pandora, and Rent the Runway. He has also served as a consultant at Technology Crossover Ventures (TCV), one of the largest growth equity firms that has invested over $10B in public and private technology companies.CEO and President.
61931-08.CEOEducation: University of Pennsylvania (Wharton), MBA (Master of Business Administration), 1980, Finance; Williams College, BA (Bachelor of Arts), 1975, History

61931-08.DealSynopsis: NBCUniversal sold an undisclosed stake in the company (NAS:PTON) to G Squared and other undisclosed investors for $178 million on April 21, 2020. A total of 5,200,000 shares were sold at $34.21 per share. The company will not receive any proceeds from the offering.
61931-08.CEOBiography: Mr. John Foley Co-Founded and served as Chief Executive Officer & Chairman of the Board of Directors at Peloton. He is a Co-Founder and serves as Chief Executive Officer and Board Member at Ernesta. He is an Angel Investor. As an avid cyclist and boutique fitness addict, Foley leveraged his tech and business experience to create Peloton, the largest interactive fitness platform in the world. Prior to founding Peloton in 2013, Foley served as a President at Barnes&Noble from 2010 to 2012, where he ran the Nook business. For the previous decade, John led various consumer technology brands, including as CEO and Co-founder of Pronto.com, CEO of Evite.com and, starting in 1996, was an early leader of Citysearch.com. He began his career working in manufacturing at Mars Inc. for six years. With honors, John earned a Bachelors of Science degree in industrial engineering from Georgia Tech (Georgia Institute of Technology) and an MBA from Harvard Business School.
61931-08.CEOEducation: Harvard Business School, MBA (Master of Business Administration), 2001; Georgia Institute of Technology, BS (Bachelor of Science), 1994, Industrial Engeneering

61931-08.DealSynopsis: The company raised $75 million of Series D venture funding from lead investor Catterton on December 2, 2015, putting the pre-money valuation at $260 million. True Ventures also participated. The funds will be used to accelerate innovation in the at-home fitness category and rapidly expand awareness and market share.
61931-08.CEOBiography: Mr. John Foley Co-Founded and served as Chief Executive Officer & Chairman of the Board of Directors at Peloton. He is a Co-Founder and serves as Chief Executive Officer and Board Member at Ernesta. He is an Angel Investor. As an avid cyclist and boutique fitness addict, Foley leveraged his tech and business experience to create Peloton, the largest interactive fitness platform in the world. Prior to founding Peloton in 2013, Foley served as a President at Barnes&Noble from 2010 to 2012, where he ran the Nook business. For the previous decade, John led various consumer technology brands, including as CEO and Co-founder of Pronto.com, CEO of Evite.com and, starting in 1996, was an early leader of Citysearch.com. He began his career working in manufacturing at Mars Inc. for six years. With honors, John earned a Bachelors of Science degree in industrial engineering from Georgia Tech (Georgia Institute of Technology) and an MBA from Harvard Business School.
61931-08.CEOEducation: Harvard Business School, MBA (Master of Business Administration), 2001; Georgia Institute of Technology, BS (Bachelor of Science), 1994, Industrial Engeneering

61931-08.DealSynopsis: The company raised $307,332 of angel funding via crowdfunding platform Kickstarter on July 1, 2013.
61931-08.CEOBiography: Mr. Dan Gilbert serves as a Business Advisor at Motus Ventures. Mr. Gilbert served as an Advisor at Trov & Peloton. He is a high-tech entrepreneur, executive, and investor. He is the co-founder and COO of San Francisco-based mobile startup BeeBell and serves on the Boards of Directors of cybersecurity leader WISeKey NA and Belgian consumer video service DVDPost. He is an investor and advisor to companies including Entytle, Premo Network, and Swell Energy, with a focus on deploying processes, systems, and teams to support rapid growth. He also serves as an Advisory Member of Motus Ventures, an accelerator focused on the Internet of Things. He was born and raised near Oklahoma City. After graduating from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology in economics, he began his career in management consulting with McKinsey & Company and A.T. Kearney, later holding leadership positions at leading technology companies including Webvan, Palm, and Cisco Systems. He served as the Executive Vice President of Operations and Customer Service at Barnes & Noble, helping to drive the company's expansion into digital reading. He led the supply chain for the NOOK® product line, spanning new product introduction, sourcing, manufacturing, distribution, and customer service. He has been an active member of the Band of Angels, Silicon Valley's longest-standing angel investment group, since 2009, serving as a Limited Partner in the Band's Acorn Fund. He serves as a Founding Contributor on the Funding Board of MIT's Sandbox Innovation Fund Program sits on the MIT Corporation's Visiting Committee for the Social Sciences, and advises QuakeFinder, a non-profit developing technology to detect and analyze electromagnetic earthquake precursors
61931-08.CEOEducation: Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT), BS (Bachelor of Science), 1991, Economics

65652-22.DealSynopsis: The company raised $78.16 million of Series C venture funding in the form of equity and debt in a deal led by Sumeru Ventures on January 10, 2022. Animoca Brands, Mitsui & Co., Modality Partnership, 9Unicorns, The Times Group, Sanjay Narang, PK Gulati, Kaval Bombra, Shriram Nene, G-Startup Worldwide, Akbar Khan, Yenom Capital and Block.one also participated in the round. As part of the transaction, Blacksoil Capital and Trifecta Capital provided debt financing in the form of notes and debt. The funds will be used to strengthen its present offerings including an app, a wearable fitness tracker, a health store, and real-time coaching and insurance services, and expand in digital therapeutics, insurance, and international markets.
65652-22.CEOBiography: Mr. Vishal Gondal is a Co-Founder & serves as Chief Executive Officer at GOQii. He serves as Board Member at Leverage Edu. He is also the Founder of Fact Venture. He started his entrepreneurial journey at the age of 16 founding IndiaGames and is best known as the Father of the Indian Gaming Industry. He is also a notable Angel Investor. Mr. Gondal, hailed as the father of the Indian gaming industry, is now a trailblazer in the Health Metaverse space. His relentless passion for technology, fitness, and gaming led him to establish GOQii, a revolutionary company focused on preventive healthcare. A strong advocate for innovation and preventive healthcare, his work with GOQii is focused on leveraging technology to promote a healthier lifestyle. GOQii seamlessly blends preventive healthcare with gaming and the Metaverse in a 3D environment. He believes that the Metaverse will merge the digital and physical worlds, making healthy living in the real world both enjoyable and enriching. He sold his first entrepreneurial venture, Indiagames, to Walt Disney. His accomplishments have earned him a spot among the top 50 executives in the mobile content space by the UK-based-Mobile Entertainment Magazine, where he was listed alongside luminaries like Steve Jobs. Beyond his business ventures, he serves on the General Council of the Tech Entrepreneurs Association of Mumbai (TEAM), a non-profit body established to advance the tech startup ecosystem in Mumbai. TEAM represents the city's leading technology companies and fosters innovation, collaboration, and policy advocacy. He is also a member of the Academic Advisory Board at the Somaiya School of Design. This institution is dedicated to nurturing creativity and innovation in design education in various design disciplines. His involvement with the Somaiya School of Design highlights his commitment to fostering the next generation of designers and innovators. His influence extends into the investment world as a notable angel investor. He ventured into the world of podcasting with his series, 'Beneath the Force: The Vishal Gondal Show'. Through this platform, he engages in conversations with personalities from various walks of life, offering listeners a glimpse into their intriguing journeys. An avid fitness enthusiast, he runs marathons, goes trekking, and enjoys skydiving. His commitment to fitness and innovation continues to inspire and shape the future of health and technology. His multifaceted career and visionary approach continue to inspire and pave the way for the integration of health, technology, and gaming, setting new benchmarks for holistic well-being.

183205-63.DealSynopsis: The company raised EUR 8.5 million of Series A venture funding in a deal led by Swiss Health Ventures, Zühlke Ventures and Khosla Ventures on August 10, 2021. Schox Patent Group, Kirin Holdings Company, Redstone VC, HAX, SOSV and Global Brain also participated in the round. The funds will be used to strengthen the company's offering to the European market, servicing patients in their native language, and to further develop existing depression treatments as well as accelerate expansion into the US market via clinical trials and FDA approval.
183205-63.CEOBiography: Mr. Daniel Månsson is a Co-Founder and Chief Clinical Officer, Managing Director & Board Member at Flow Neuroscience. He served as Chief Executive Officer at Flow Neuroscience. He has a background in software development but is also a psychologist. As a Clinical Psychologist with over 10 years of brain stimulation research and a background in Computer Science, Daniel has made it his mission to merge technology with psychology to treat mental health across the world. As a result of this mission, Daniel co-founded Flow Neuroscience, a neurotech company with a focus on rigorous science, empowerment and accessibility. The first product born from this was Flow, the only medically-certified device to treat Major Depressive Disorder combining brain stimulation with behavioural therapy.

183205-63.CEOBiography: Ms. Erin Lee serves as Chief Executive Officer at Flow Neuroscience. She is an experienced executive who has spent 20+ years building exceptional global teams for some of the world's largest and fastest-growing consumer technology companies, including Uber, Google, and most recently, Babylon Health, where she led global operations and expansion of the business. Her goal is to bring world-class customer experiences to the healthcare industry. Few things are more precious than health and the average experience for patients today is stressful, confusing, and lacks personalized care. she is committed to bringing this change across mental disorders, particularly for depression and addiction where current solutions are woefully inadequate with very few accessible medication-free options.

458417-44.CEOBiography: Mr. Bhuvan Srinivasan serves as Chief Business Officer and Board Member at Ultrahuman. He served as Director, Private Equity at Kohlberg Kravis Roberts. Bhuvan Srinivasan joined KKR in 2014 and is a member of the Private Equity team focused on health care, industrials, media/technology, and education. He is also part of the Global Impact team. Mr. Srinivasan has been involved in KKR's investments in EuroKids International, Ramky Enviro Engineers Limited, Radiant Life Care, Emerald Media, JBF, Gland Pharma and Coffee Day Holdings. Prior to joining KKR, Mr. Srinivasan was with Bain Capital in Mumbai for over three years. Prior to that, Mr. Srinivasan worked at Bain & Company in Singapore as a strategy consultant serving clients in Southeast Asia and the Middle East. Prior to Bain & Company, Mr. Srinivasan was a research scientist working on real-time glucose sensing at Medtronic Diabetes in Los Angeles. Mr. Srinivasan holds MSE and BSE degrees with honors in Biomedical Engineering from the Johns Hopkins University and an M.B.A. with honors from The Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania.

50982-94.DealSynopsis: The company was acquired by Alphabet (NAS: GOOGL) for $2.1 billion on January 14, 2021. With the acquisition, the company will be able to accelerate innovation in the wearables category, scale faster and make health even more accessible to everyone.
50982-94.CEOBiography: Mr. James Park serves as Board Member & Member of the Human Capital and Compensation Committee at Kraft Heinz. He serves as an Advisor at Commons. He currently serves as Vice President and General Manager of Fitbit at Google LLC, a subsidiary of Alphabet Inc. He previously served as Chief Executive Officer, President, and Chairman of the board of directors of Fitbit, Inc. until its acquisition by Google in January 2021. He is a technology entrepreneur who co-founded Fitbit, Inc., a connected health and fitness company, that was acquired by Google in January 2021. He is the Vice President and General Manager, of Fitbit at Google. He previously served as Chief Executive Officer, President, and member of the board of directors of Fitbit since 2007, and as chairman of the board of directors from 2015, until its acquisition. He is a leader in the technology industry with a strong track record of ideating and operating successful technology companies. He was also the co-founder of Wind-Up Labs, Inc., an online photo-sharing company acquired by CNET Networks, Inc. in 2005, and Epesi Technologies, Inc. In 2015, he was named to Fortune magazine's 40 Under 40, an annual ranking of the most influential young people in business.
